â€¢ **Multiple Columns:** When working with multiple columns, separate column names with **comma + space**. Example: `Program Name, University Type`
â€¢ **Column Order:** The order you write is preserved for operations, not the Excel column order. For division: `A, B` means A Ã· B. For the reverse, write `B, A`.
â€¢ **Non-Numeric Values:** For mathematical operations (addition, division, etc.), rows with non-numeric cells will return ERROR or be skipped.

â€¢ **Block Order Matters:** The order of blocks affects the result. Example: RANK/WINDOW â†’ FILTER: First ranking, then filter. FILTER â†’ RANK/WINDOW: First filter, then ranking. **Second file operations (MERGE, DIFF etc.) are typically used first.** OUTPUT SETTINGS: Always at the end.
â€¢ **Optional Fields:** Fields marked as optional can be left empty. Required fields cannot be empty.

â€¢ **Second File Usage:** For MERGE, UNION, DIFF, and VALIDATE operations, upload a second file from the left panel. **You can use other operations (FILTER, RANK, CALCULATION etc.) after these in the same report.** Example: First add price table with MERGE, then calculate profit margin with CALCULATION.
**ğŸ“ BUTTON ORDER GUIDE** â€” Recommended position for each operation type:
â€¢ **VARIABLE:** â–¶ï¸ Add BEFORE the CALCULATION that uses it
â€¢ **MERGE / UNION / DIFF / VALIDATE (Second File):** â–¶ï¸ Usually used at the BEGINNING
â€¢ **CALCULATION / TEXT TRANSFORM:** â–¶ï¸ BEFORE RANK, for data enrichment
â€¢ **RANK / WINDOW:** â–¶ï¸ BEFORE FILTER (calculates on all data)
â€¢ **FILTER:** â–¶ï¸ AFTER RANK (to see filtered results)
â€¢ **GROUP & AGGREGATE:** â–¶ï¸ To summarize data, REDUCES row count
â€¢ **SORT:** â–¶ï¸ As one of the last operations
â€¢ **PIVOT TABLE:** â–¶ï¸ Towards the end, for summary tables
â€¢ **CONDITIONAL FORMATTING:** â–¶ï¸ AFTER FILTER, BEFORE OUTPUT
â€¢ **CHART:** â–¶ï¸ AFTER all data operations, BEFORE OUTPUT
â€¢ **OUTPUT SETTINGS:** â–¶ï¸ ALWAYS AT THE END
**ğŸ“š GENERAL USAGE** â€” Click the colorful buttons above to add operation blocks to your report. Reorder blocks using up/down arrows.
**ğŸ† RANK / WINDOW BUTTON** â€” Uses Excel's window functions. Calculates within-group ranking, counting, or cumulative totals.
â€¢ **Function Selection (Required):** Rank | Dense Rank | Row Number | Count (Group) | Percent Rank | Cumulative Sum
â€¢ **Partition By (Optional):** Determines which group the ranking is done within. If empty, all data is one group.
â€¢ **Order By:** What the ranking is based on. Can be empty for Count function.
â€¢ **Direction:** Ascending = small to large, Descending = large to small
â€¢ **New Column Name (Required):** Name of the column to be created
**ğŸ” FILTER BUTTON** â€” Used to narrow down data.
â€¢ **Column Name (Required):** Name of the column to filter
â€¢ **Operator Options:** Equals | Not Equals | Greater/Less Than | Contains | Does Not Contain | Starts/Ends With | In List | Not In List | Is Empty | Regex
â€¢ **Value:** Value to compare against
**ğŸ§® CALCULATION BUTTON** â€” Creates a new calculated column.
â€¢ **New Column Name (Required):** Name of the column to be created
â€¢ **Types:** Arithmetic | Conditional (IF/ELSE) | Concatenate | Date Difference | Text Transform
**ğŸ“¦ GROUP & AGGREGATE BUTTON** â€” Summarizes data and reduces row count. Pivot Table logic.
â€¢ **Group By (Required):** Columns to group by
â€¢ **Aggregation Function:** Column + Function (Sum, Count, Average, Median, Min, Max, etc.)
**â¬†ï¸â¬‡ï¸ SORT BUTTON** â€” Arranges results with simple sorting.
â€¢ **Column (Required):** Column to sort by
â€¢ **Direction:** Ascending (Aâ†’Z, 1â†’9) or Descending (Zâ†’A, 9â†’1)
**ğŸ¨ CONDITIONAL FORMATTING BUTTON** â€” Applies visual rules to cells.
â€¢ **Target Column (Required):** Column to apply formatting
â€¢ **Rule Types:** Color Scale (3-Color) | Color Scale (2-Color) | Data Bar | Icon Set | Threshold Rule | Text Contains | Top N / Bottom N
â€¢ **Color Settings:** Min/Mid/Max colors customizable
**ğŸ“Š ADD CHART BUTTON** â€” Creates embedded charts in Excel.
â€¢ **Chart Types:** Column | Bar | Line | Area | Pie | Doughnut | Scatter
â€¢ **X Axis:** Category column (e.g. Month, University)
â€¢ **Y Axis:** Value column (e.g. Total, Count)
â€¢ **Chart Title (Optional):** Displayed at the top of the chart
**ğŸ“‹ PIVOT TABLE BUTTON** â€” Creates advanced summary tables.
â€¢ **Row Fields (Required):** Grouping columns (comma separated)
â€¢ **Column Fields (Optional):** For cross-tabulation
â€¢ **Value Fields:** Column + Function + Alias
â€¢ **Totals/Subtotals:** Grand Total and group-level subtotals
â€¢ **Percent Type:** Row | Column | Grand total percentage
**ğŸ”§ DEFINE VARIABLE BUTTON** â€” Defines constant values for calculations.
â€¢ **Variable Name:** Name for use in calculations (no spaces)
â€¢ **Value:** Numeric or text value
â€¢ **Usage:** Use as `$VariableName` in CALCULATION blocks
**ğŸ“„ OUTPUT SETTINGS BUTTON** â€” Determines how the Excel file is generated.
â€¢ **Output Type:** Single Sheet | Summary + Detail | Sheet Per Group (Drill-Down)
â€¢ **Group Column:** Which column to split sheets by
â€¢ **Add Summary:** Should a summary sheet be created?

â€¢ **Excel Enhancements (Auto):** âœ“ Header freeze | âœ“ Auto-fit columns | âœ“ Header styling | âœ“ Number formatting
**ğŸ”— MERGE BUTTON (SECOND FILE)** â€” Joins two files using VLOOKUP logic.
â€¢ **Main File Column:** Column from main file for matching (e.g. Product ID)
â€¢ **Second File Column:** Column from second file for matching
â€¢ **Join Type:**
- **LEFT (VLOOKUP):** Keeps all rows from main file. If no match in second file, those columns will be empty.
- **INNER (Only Matching):** Returns only rows that exist in both files. Non-matching rows are excluded.
- **RIGHT:** Keeps all rows from second file. If no match in main file, those columns will be empty.
- **FULL (All):** Returns all rows from both files. Unmatched fields will be empty.
**ğŸ“ UNION BUTTON (SECOND FILE)** â€” Appends two files vertically (UNION).
â€¢ Columns are matched automatically. Missing columns remain empty.
**ğŸ” DIFF BUTTON (SECOND FILE)** â€” Finds records in main file that do NOT exist in second file.
â€¢ **Main File Column:** Column to compare from main file
â€¢ **Second File Column:** Column to compare from second file
â€¢ **Result:** Only records found in main file but not in second file
**âœ“ VALIDATE BUTTON (SECOND FILE)** â€” Checks if values exist in a reference list.
â€¢ **Check Column:** Column to check from main file
â€¢ **Reference Column:** Valid values list from second file
â€¢ **Result Column Name:** Name for the validation column (Valid/Invalid)
